verses.verse: Better <WH2896> is a dry <WH2720> morsel, <WH6595> and quietness <WH7962> therewith, than an house <WH1004> full <WH4392> of sacrifices <WH2077> with strife. <WH7379>
A wise <WH7919> servant <WH5650> shall have rule <WH4910> over a son <WH1121> that causes shame, <WH954> and shall have part <WH2505> of the inheritance <WH5159> among <WH8432> the brothers. <WH251>
The fining <WH4715> pot <WH4715> is for silver, <WH3701> and the furnace <WH3564> for gold: <WH2091> but the LORD <WH3068> tries <WH974> the hearts. <WH3826>
A wicked <WH7489> doer gives heed <WH7181> to false <WH205> lips; <WH8193> and a liar <WH8267> gives ear <WH238> to a naughty <WH1942> tongue. <WH3956>
Whoever mocks <WH3932> the poor <WH7326> reproaches <WH2778> his Maker: <WH6213> and he that is glad <WH8056> at calamities <WH343> shall not be unpunished. <WH5352>
Children's <WH1121> children <WH1121> are the crown <WH5850> of old <WH2205> men; and the glory <WH8597> of children <WH1121> are their fathers. <WH1>
Excellent <WH3499> speech <WH8193> becomes <WH5000> not a fool: <WH5036> much <WH637> less do lying <WH8267> lips <WH8193> a prince. <WH5081>
A gift <WH7810> is as a precious <WH2580> stone <WH68> in the eyes <WH5869> of him that has <WH1167> it: wherever <WH413> it turns, <WH6437> it prospers. <WH7919>
He that covers <WH3680> a transgression <WH6588> seeks <WH1245> love; <WH160> but he that repeats <WH8138> a matter <WH1697> separates <WH6504> very friends. <WH441>
A reproof <WH1606> enters <WH5181> more into a wise <WH995> man than an hundred <WH3967> stripes <WH5221> into a fool. <WH3684>
An evil <WH7451> man seeks <WH1245> only <WH389> rebellion: <WH4805> therefore a cruel <WH394> messenger <WH4397> shall be sent <WH7971> against him.
Let a bear <WH1677> robbed <WH7909> of her whelps meet <WH6298> a man, <WH376> rather <WH408> than a fool <WH3684> in his folly. <WH200>
Whoever rewards <WH7725> evil <WH7451> for good, <WH2896> evil <WH7451> shall not depart <WH4185> from his house. <WH1004>
The beginning <WH7225> of strife <WH4066> is as when one lets <WH6362> out water: <WH4325> therefore leave <WH5203> off contention, <WH7379> before <WH6440> it be meddled <WH1566> with.
He that justifies <WH6663> the wicked, <WH7563> and he that condemns <WH7561> the just, <WH6662> even <WH1571> they both <WH8147> are abomination <WH8441> to the LORD. <WH3068>
Why <WH4100> <WH2088> is there a price <WH4242> in the hand <WH3027> of a fool <WH3684> to get <WH7069> wisdom, <WH2451> seeing he has no <WH369> heart <WH3820> to it?
A friend <WH7453> loves <WH157> at all <WH3605> times, <WH6256> and a brother <WH251> is born <WH3205> for adversity. <WH6869>
A man <WH120> void <WH2638> of understanding <WH3820> strikes <WH8628> hands, <WH3709> and becomes <WH6148> surety <WH6161> in the presence <WH6440> of his friend. <WH7453>
He loves <WH157> transgression <WH6588> that loves <WH157> strife: <WH4683> and he that exalts <WH1361> his gate <WH6607> seeks <WH1245> destruction. <WH7667>
He that has a fraudulent <WH6141> heart <WH3820> finds <WH4672> no <WH3808> good: <WH2896> and he that has a perverse <WH2015> tongue <WH3956> falls <WH5307> into mischief. <WH7451>
He that begets <WH3205> a fool <WH3684> does it to his sorrow: <WH8424> and the father <WH1> of a fool <WH5036> has no <WH3808> joy. <WH8056>
A merry <WH8056> heart <WH3820> does good <WH3190> like a medicine: <WH1456> but a broken <WH5218> spirit <WH7307> dries <WH3001> the bones. <WH1634>
A wicked <WH7563> man takes <WH3947> a gift <WH7810> out of the bosom <WH2436> to pervert <WH5186> the ways <WH734> of judgment. <WH4941>
Wisdom <WH2451> is before <WH854> <WH6440> him that has understanding; <WH995> but the eyes <WH5869> of a fool <WH3684> are in the ends <WH7097> of the earth. <WH776>
A foolish <WH3684> son <WH1121> is a grief <WH3708> to his father, <WH1> and bitterness <WH4470> to her that bore <WH3205> him.
Also <WH1571> to punish <WH6064> the just <WH6662> is not good, <WH2896> nor to strike <WH5221> princes <WH5081> for equity. <WH3476>
He that has knowledge <WH1847> spares <WH2820> his words: <WH561> and a man <WH376> of understanding <WH8394> is of an excellent <WH7119> spirit. <WH7307>
Even <WH1571> a fool, <WH191> when he holds <WH2790> his peace, <WH2790> is counted <WH2803> wise: <WH2450> and he that shuts <WH331> his lips <WH8193> is esteemed a man of understanding. <WH995>
